abstract: Iowa Supreme Court strikes down 2013 Iowa Board of Medicine rule requiring doctors to perform physical examination on patients before prescribing abortion-inducing drugs and to be present when drugs are taken; says doctors may continue to provide such services to people in rural areas via videoconference, as they have since 2008.
lead_paragraph: In a unanimous ruling, the Iowa Supreme Court struck down a rule preventing doctors from using telemedicine to dispense abortion-inducing pills in remote clinics.

headline.main: Iowa Court Ruling Says Doctors Can Prescribe Abortion Drugs by Video
headline.print_headline: Iowa Court Ruling Says Doctors Can Prescribe Abortion Drugs by Video

snippet: In a unanimous ruling, the Iowa Supreme Court struck down a rule preventing doctors from using telemedicine to dispense abortion-inducing pills in remote clinics.
